result.execSummary:
The defendant Andrai Alonzo Barrios was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Pay mandatory costs, assessments and surcharges at the rate of $50.00 per month commencing 12/01/15 or if a payment is more than 10 days late, a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant and subject to other collection.
Defendant to provide a DNA sample.

*Commencing  by noon on 08/21/15. Huber for work AODA treatment or counseling.
*Court advises the defendant any possession or use of any illegally controlled substance or alcohol forfeits the release privileges.
*Court advises the defendant he may not possess a firearm and can not vote until his civil rights are restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Andrai Alonzo Barrios

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Andrai Alonzo Barrios in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Sentencing proceeds.  Statements by counsel and defendant.

Court advises the defendant he may not possess a firearm; is to provide a DNA sample and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.  

COURT ORDERS defendant to serve 4 months at the House of Correction commencing by noon on 8-21-15 with Huber for work and AODA treatment or counseling; pay mandatory costs, assessments and surcharges at the rate of $50 per month commencing 12-1-15 or if a payment is more than 10 days late, a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant and subject to other collection.

COURT ORDERS:
- defendant to provide a DNA sample.

Court advises the defendant any possession or use of any illegally controlled substance or alcohol forfeits the release privileges. 

Appeal rights given.  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief  and Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement received and filed.

Defendant Andrai Alonzo Barrios in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Defense moves for an adjournment in order for defendant to make arrangements for transportation to and from work.  Court denies motion to adjourn.  Case is passed.

Defendant Andrai Alonzo Barrios in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Dennis Patrick Murphy  for Zachary Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty.   Judgment of conviction entered.  Parties advised as of August 1, 2015 case will be transferred to Branch 44.   Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 44.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 4, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Andrai Alonzo Barrios in court.  Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin for Zachary Wittchow.
Case scheduled for plea hearing.  Attorney Mary Garvin Guimont called and informed the court she has a medical emergency, and unable to appear.  Case adjourned for projected guilty plea on 5/22/2015 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  Court reminds defendant to not use or possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription.  aw  Plea hearing scheduled for May 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Andrai Alonzo Barrios in court.  Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case scheduled for plea and sentencing.  Attorney Garvin Guimont called and informed the court she is in trial before Judge Watts.  Case adjourned for projected guilty plea on 5/15/2015 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  aw  Plea hearing scheduled for May 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant Andrai Alonzo Barrios in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 7, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  DOriginal Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.

Defendant Andrai Alonzo Barrios in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Ron Dague for Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Stark.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Fiorenza, Br. 03.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.

The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  Oral No Weapons Order, No use or possession of any controlled substances without a valid prescription  Preliminary hearing scheduled for 02-26-2015 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Andrai Alonzo Barrios
Current: 406 South Front Street, #3, Rochester, WI 53167   (Effective: 02-18-2015)
Prior: 406 South Front Street, #3, Rochester, WI 53167

Defendant Andrai Alonzo Barrios in court with attorney Gregory A. Renden.  Chad Wozniak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.vb
SUMMONS MAILED. DEFENDANT ORDERED INTO ROOM 221 SAFETY BUILDING ON  2/18/15 @ 1 PM
